alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 11:39AM PDT until August 20 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern California, including the following county, San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 145 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1138 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate light to moderate rain has been decreasing across northwest San Bernardino County. However, minor flooding of some roads is ongoing. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Barstow, Fort Irwin, Daggett, Owl Canyon Campground, Newberry Springs, and Lenwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
